alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Carbon and Monroe Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gouldsboro State Park, or 7 miles northwest of Mount Pocono, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Mount Pocono, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Nesquehoning, Wind Gap, Weatherly, Stormville, Werry Lake, Pocono Pines, Lake Harmony, Skytop, Tannersville, Long Pond, Kresgeville, Sun Valley, Reeders and Beltzville State Park. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 72 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania.
